Training and Testing

The training and testing window is a class that is divided into 2 subframes which can be alternated. It also sonatains some general functions that are shared between them.

The menu class holds several functions .. autoclass:: GUI.test_train_menu.menu

A generic entry point

GUI.test_train_menu.menu.add_elements(self)

Creates the tkinter notebook and parent frames for the test and train subwindows, then, calls the subfuntions for each.

which calls the train specific builders:

GUI.test_train_menu.menu.add_train_elements(self)

add the elements to the train subwindow in the notebook.

GUI.test_train_menu.menu.grid_trainframe(self)

grids all elements in the train subwindow.

and the test specific builders:

GUI.test_train_menu.menu.add_test_elements(self)

add the elements to the test subwindow in the notebook.

GUI.test_train_menu.menu.grid_testframe(self)

grids all elements in the test subwindow.

Logic

these functions aid with adding and removing test and train elements and fill out dynamic elements.

GUI.test_train_menu.menu.add_to_list(self, from_frame: str)

Adds a train or test banner to its respective window, based on the currently selected options in the window. It validates the elements in the desired window before adding them, and displays error messages if neccesary.

Parameters

from_frame – to which window to add the test/experiment. options -> train, test

GUI.test_train_menu.menu.remove_from_list(self, from_frame: str)

removes the last element from the selected list.

Parameters

from_frame – from which window to remove the test/experiment. options -> train, test

GUI.test_train_menu.menu.populate_embedding_listbox_test(self, event)

depending on the selected agent it displays which embeddings are generated for it.

Parameters

event – the tcl event that is bound to the operation.

Scrollables

These functions are meant to create an scrollable menu for the canvas which contains the tests and train elements.

GUI.test_train_menu.menu._bound_to_mousewheel(self, event, canvas: Canvas)

binds the mousewheel scrolling to the canvas scrolling while the mouse is over.

Parameters

  • event – the tcl event that is bound to the operation. Mouseon in this case.

  • canvas – the display canvas that hosts the banners.

GUI.test_train_menu.menu._unbound_to_mousewheel(self, event, canvas: Canvas)

removes the mousewheel bind on mouseoff.

Parameters

  • event – the tcl event that is bound to the operation. Mouseoff in this case

  • canvas – the display canvas that hosts the banners

GUI.test_train_menu.menu._on_mousewheel(self, event, canvas: Canvas)

How the canvas scrolls based on the scrollwheels delta.

Parameters

  • event – the tcl event that is bound to the operation. In this case the scrollwheel turning.

  • canvas – the display canvas that hosts the banners

GUI.test_train_menu.menu._configure_window(self, event, canvas: Canvas, frame: Frame)

Sets up the window sizes and prepares it for the elements.

Parameters

  • event – the tcl event that is bound to the operation.

  • canvas – the canvas object where the elements will display.

  • frame – the parent frame that contains the canvas.

Returns

bar

Raises

fooException – bar

Validation

Finally some helper validation functions for some of the elements.

GUI.test_train_menu.menu.ValidateRange(self, value: str)

Recieves a value and checks that is a number

Parameters

value – the value in the textbox

GUI.test_train_menu.menu.InvalidInput(self)

Error text displays when laps inputs is invalid.
